taskbody.context: An important feature of the Page Designer is the ability to re-use visual components. This is achieved by taking a small, fine-grained diagram (child diagram) of a file, such as a fragment or a module, and including it in a larger diagram (parent diagram) of a file, such as a module or a page. A fragment can be used in a page if it only has static data (for example, button, label,) and no domain attributes.

step.cmd: On the DS Navigator view pane, double-click the file (parent diagram) in which you want to include a child diagram.

stepresult.p: The file's diagram opens in the Editor area.

step.cmd: On the DS Navigator view pane, click and hold the left mouse button on the file that you want to use as a child diagram.
Drag the file to the parent diagram in the Editor area, and then, release the button at the desired location.

stepresult.p: The child diagram is included in the parent diagram. It is greyed to show it as an inclusion.

step.cmd: To open the child diagram in the Editor area, double-click it. As a child diagram, you cannot access its individual elements.
